clinical_study.brief_title: Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation and Functional Electrical Stimulation for Rehabilitation After Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between the Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) and Functional Electrical Stimulation (FES) for Rehabilitation After Stroke - A Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal University of Health Science of Porto Alegre

clinical_study.source: Federal University of Health Science of Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to verify the effects of the Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS), Functional Electrical Stimulation (FES), and the combination of both therapies (tDCS + FES) for rehabilitation of chronic stroke patients.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Upper-limb reaching analysis evaluated by means of the 3-D motion analysis system (BTS SMART DX 400)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

primary_outcome.measure: Gait analysis evaluated by means of the 3-D motion analysis system (BTS SMART DX 400)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

primary_outcome.measure: Postural Control evaluated by means of force platform (BTS P-6000)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Grip force assessed by means of dynamometer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Strength of wrist flexors and extensors evaluated by means of cell load
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscular activity of wrist flexors and extensors, evaluated by means of Electromyography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Uni-manual hand functions required for activities of daily living via Jebsen Hand Function Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Manual dexterity assessed by means of the block and box test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hand sensibility assessed by means of esthesiometer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life assessed by means of the Stroke-Specific Quality of Life (SSQOL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum levels of Cortisol, BDNF, IGF-1 and IGFBP-3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscular tone assessed by the Modified Ashworth Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Sensorimotor Recovery After Stroke by the Fugl-Meyer scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Pre to Post 1 (after the 5th session), Post 2 (after the 10th session) and Post 3 (3 months follow-up)

arm_group.description: Chronic stroke patients submitted to transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS).
Chronic stroke patients submitted to functional electrical stimulation (FES).
Chronic stroke patients submitted to transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) and functional and to functional electrical stimulation (FES).

Functional Electrical Stimulation (FES) + Sham Transcranial direct brain stimulation (tDCS)
Real Functional Electrical Stimulation (FES) + Real Transcranial direct brain stimulation (tDCS)
